"Eyepatch": {
"tier": 1

"sleekEffect": "Reduces your threat to enemies by 10%. This only changes which player an enemy prioritizes in combat."
Fin Flops and Fin Flops+:
Piece Effect: Increases swimming speed by 30%.
Sleek Effect: Reduces the amount of stamina drained while sprinting by 10%.
[These two items have the exact same stats across the board. Same buffs too. The Fin Flops+ are most likely bugged.]
Gill Tube:
Piece Effect: Reduces oxygen consumption while swimming by 50%.
Sleek Effect: Increases the rate that stamina regenerates by 20%.
Grub Set:
Piece Effect: Increases maximum stamina by 10.
Sleek Effect: Increases the rate that stamina regenerates by 15%.
Set Bonus: Reduces the time it takes for stamina to begin to regenerate by 10%.
Mite Hat:
Piece Effect: Increases the rate that stamina regenerates by 15%.
Sleek Effect: Reduces the time it takes for stamina to begin to regenerate by 5%.
Red Ant Set:
Piece Effect: Increases hauling capacity by 3.
Sleek Effect: Increases damage while harvesting grass by 25%.
Set Bonus: Makes Red Ant faction neutral towards you, preventing them from attacking if you don't anger them first by attacking them or stealing eggs.
Tier 2
Bee Set:
Piece Effect: Bow attacks have a 200% chance to do an additional 3 stun per attack.
[This is most likely bugged and should be 20% (.2) and not 200% (2) in the code].
Sleek Effect: Bow attacks have a 50% chance to slow enemy movement speed by 20% for 5 seconds.
Set Bonus: Bow attacks have a 25% chance to create a pollen explosion that does 5 stun in a 700 range radius.
Black Ant Set:
Piece Effect: Blocking an attack has a 50% chance to increase critical chance by 1% for 15 seconds.
Sleek Effect: Critting an attack has a 50% chance to increase stamina regeneration rate by 20% for 20 seconds.
Set Bonus: 50% of damage received is also applied to the attacking enemy.
Bubble Helmet:
Piece Effect: Reduces oxygen consumption while swimming by 75%.
Sleek Effect: Increases the rate that stamina regenerates by 20%.
Firefly
Piece Effect: Attaches a small, directional light to your helmet.
Sleek Effect: Increases damage by 25% when harvesting rocks.
Koi Set:
Piece Effect: Increases the amount of time to perform a perfect parry by 15 ms.
Sleek Effect: Perfect blocks have a 20% chance to apply a 10 second buff that causes all of your attacks to do an additional 1 stun.
Set Bonus: Perfect blocks have a 100% chance to apply acid to the blocked enemy, increases the damage they take by 20% for 10 seconds.
Ladybug Set:
Piece Effect: Increases the block gauge by 25, allowing you to block more attacks before becoming stunned.
Sleek Effect: Increases healing received by 12%.
Set Bonus: Blocking an attack has a 50% chance to apply health regeneration that heals for 1 hp every 2 seconds for 20 seconds.
Marksman's cap:
Piece Effect: Critical bow attacks have a 50% chance to refund 12 stamina.
Sleek Effect: Increases bow attack damage by 20%.
Spider Set:
Piece Effect: Reduces the time it takes for stamina to begin to regenerate by 5%.
Sleek Effect: Attacks have a 100% chance to debuff the enemy, increasing how much damage they take from poisons by X% for 20 seconds. Helmet: 20%. Chest: 40%. Legs: 30%.
Set Bonus: Increases the rate that stamina regenerates by 25%.
Tier 3
Antlion Set:
Piece Effect: Sizzle accumulation is reduced by 75%. Stacks multiplicative with other sources of sizzle reduction.

[This is an assumption on my part that i still need to confirm, but this is my best guess for now. Each piece gives .25 SizzleRateMultiplier, so three pieces would be .25 * .25 * .25 = 0.015625, or roughly a 98.4% reduction. To give context here, the sizzle reduction meals provide the same amount at .25, the Thor trinket provides .9, and the perk provides .25]
Sleek Effect: Thirst decays 5% slower.

Set Bonus: Bow attacks have a 100% chance to increase attack speed with all weapons by 40% for 3 seconds in addition to reducing all melee and thrown damage by 90% for 3 seconds.
Also reduces the duration of the debuff you receive after firing a crossbow from 2.3 seconds down to 1.3 seconds.
Assassin Set:
Piece Effect: Critical attacks have a 50% chance to apply a bleed doing 20 damage a second for 10 seconds.
Sleek Effect: Critical attacks have a 30% chance to do an additional 25 stun.
Set Bonus: Critical charged attacks increase critical chance by 2.5% for 10 seconds.
Black Ox Set:
Piece Effect: Melee charged attacks have a 33% chance to reduce the struck enemy's attack damage by 20% for 15 seconds.
Sleek Effect: All attacks have their charge up time reduced by 12%.
Set Bonus: Melee charged attacks have a 100% chance to add an additional 25 stun.
Fire Ant Set:
Piece Effect: Melee attacks have a 10% chance to debuff the enemy with acid, causing them to take 15% more damage for 10 seconds.
Sleek Effect: Acid damage is increased by 10%.
Set Bonus: Melee attacks have a 10% chance to cause 25 acid damage to a single enemy. Acid damage bypasses enemy defense and all resistances.
Fluffy Pupa Hat:
Piece Effect: Increases hauling capacity by 5.
Sleek Effect: Reduces the time it takes for stamina to begin regenerating after becoming fully exhausted by 50%.
Broodmother Set:
Per Piece Bonus: Gives your attacks a 25% chance to apply a poison dealing 16 damage every 5 seconds for 30 seconds.
Per Sleek Bonus: Gives your attacks a 25% chance to apply a venom dealing 18 damage every 5 seconds for 30 seconds.
Set Bonus: Gives your melee attacks a 10% chance to apply poison to all enemies around the hit target (400 range AoE) dealing 30 damage every 5 seconds for 25 seconds.

Note: This set bonus only works with Axes, Clubs, Daggers, Hammers, Spears, Swords, Unarmed, and Shovels. It will not work off bows, crossbows, staves, bombs, or explosives.  Set bonus AoE does not do friendly fire.
Moth Set:
Piece Effect: Bow and staff attacks have a 30% chance to apply a bleed dealing 20 damage a second for 5 seconds.
Sleek Effect: Bow and staff attacks have a 5% chance to instantly refund 15 stamina on hit.
Set Bonus: Bow and staff attacks have a 25% chance to increase movement speed by 20% for 10 seconds.
Roly Poly Set:
Piece Effect: Blocked attacks cause 3 stun to the attacker.
Sleek Effect: Increases the block gauge by 50, allowing you to block more attacks before becoming stunned.
Set Bonus: Increases threat to enemies by 50%. This only changes which player an enemy prioritizes in combat.
Termite Armor:
Piece Effect: Provides full dust immunity.

Sleek Effect: Melee attacks have a 10% chance to cause an acid splash dealing 5 burning damage to all enemies within 300 range. This also generates a dust cloud that lasts for 5 seconds that reduces enemy attack speed by 20% and movement speed by 25% for 1 second, this debuff will be reapplied for as long as the enemy remains in the dust cloud and lingers for 1 second upon leaving.
Widow Set:
Piece Effect: Attacks have a 100% chance to debuff the enemy, increasing how much damage they take from poisons by X% for 20 seconds. Helmet: 20%. Chest: 40%. Legs: 30%.
Sleek Effect: Perfect blocks have a 20% chance to poison enemies, causing them to take 15 damage every 5 seconds for 30 seconds.
Set Bonus: Kills have a 100% chance to increase movement speed by 20% for 10 seconds.
Wizard Hat:
Piece Effect: Bow and staff attacks have a 50% chance to apply a buff that increases the perfect parry window by 30ms for 10 seconds.

[Despite the in-game tooltip implying otherwise, this increased parry window doesn't only work with staves. Once you get the buff it globally increases your parry window for any equipped weapon. The buff can also be proced with both bows and staves, not just staves. This is most likely a bug caused by not adding Stats.Attacks.Staff as the DamageSourceTags.]
Sleek Effect: Perfect blocks with any weapon applies a buff that increases staff attack damage by 40% for 10 seconds.

[There doesn't seem to be a specific weapon type tag that can also be applied to perfect blocking, so this working with any weapon is most likely not a bug and just a necessity. The damage increase appropriately only works for staves.]
Wasp Set:
Piece Effect: 30% chance for uncharged bow attack hits to apply a buff to yourself for 10 seconds that reduces the charge up time of your attacks by 25%
Sleek Effect: 30% chance for charged bow attack hits to apply a buff to yourself for 10 seconds that causes your uncharged bow hits to generate 30 stamina.
Set Bonus: Gives your uncharged bow and staff attacks a 75% chance to apply an additional 30 stun to flying enemies.
Bard's Tudor:
Piece Effect:
Gives your charged bow attacks a 25% chance to debuff all enemies within 2000 range, reducing their attack damage by 20% for 10 seconds.
Also gives your charged bow attacks a 10% chance to debuff all enemies within 2000 range, increasing the amount of damage they take by 20% for 10 seconds.
Only one of these two debuffs may be active at a time.
Additionally, sets the player as part of the wasp faction, making all wasps neutral towards the player and makes wasp's enemies hostile towards the player (such as bees).
Sleek Effect:
Gives your charged bow attacks a 50% chance to bleed enemies within 2000 range, causing them to take 5 damage per second for 10 seconds.

Additionally, empowers your Bardic Inspiration Mutation's melody, giving it a 25% chance to apply a heal over time to players within 3000 range, healing for 5 health every 2 seconds for 10 seconds. This buff is not unique with the other 3 melody buffs, meaning you can have this heal over time AND 1 other bard buff active at the same time.
Infected Broodmother Set
Piece Bonus: Gives your explosive attacks an extra 5 stun.
Sleek Bonus: Gives your explosive attacks a 10% chance to reduce the enemy's resistance to any players explosives by 20% for 20 seconds.

Set Bonus: Gives your explosive attacks a 10% chance to drop an additional bomb on the enemy, dealing 70 explosive damage in a 300 range AoE. These cluster bombs do not do friendly fire or self damage.
Note: This set bonus does not trigger off summoned minion explosions from the new accessory.
